section: Client agrees to pay to Company to design and develop a website for Client (the "Client Website") in accordance with the accompanying Scope of Work, attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A. (a) Change Orders. Any changes to the Scope of Work following the execution of this Agreement requiring Additional Work must be submitted to and accepted by Company in writing as a "Change Order". Additional Work shall be defined as the addition or revision of pages, graphics, or other features, any text, graphic or page design or programming requiring more than two rounds of textual or graphical revisions, substantial revisions to text and/or content provided by Client, changes to elements which have been finalized, or significant changes in the Scope of Work.
explanation: The phrase "addition or revision of pages, graphics, or other features, any text, graphic or page design or programming requiring more than two rounds of textual or graphical revisions, substantial revisions to text and/or content provided by Client, changes to elements which have been finalized, or significant changes in the Scope of Work" is structurally flawed and hard to interpret. It's unclear what the relationship between these elements is. Is it that ANY of these things constitute 'Additional Work'? Or is it a combination of some of them? The sentence construction is such that the meaning becomes muddled.

section: Client agrees to pay to Company to design and develop a website for Client (the "Client Website") in accordance with the accompanying Scope of Work, attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A. (a) Change Orders. Any changes to the Scope of Work following the execution of this Agreement requiring Additional Work must be submitted to and accepted by Company in writing as a "Change Order". Additional Work shall be defined as the addition or revision of pages, graphics, or other features, any text, graphic or page design or programming requiring more than two rounds of textual or graphical revisions, substantial revisions to text and/or content provided by Client, changes to elements which have been finalized, or significant changes in the Scope of Work.
explanation: The definition of 'Additional Work' includes 'changes to elements which have been finalized'. However, the contract does not define what constitutes 'finalized'. Does this mean finalized by the Company, the Client, or both? Without a clear definition, this term is ambiguous and open to interpretation, potentially leading to disputes about whether a change constitutes 'Additional Work' subject to additional charges.

section: Company will not make any attempt to proof read or correct any contextual, grammatical or typographical errors in the written content submitted by Client. It is Client's sole responsibility to check the accuracy of the written content and correct any errors prior to submission for final publication. Company will assume that all the written content submitted by Client has been proofread and is ready for publication. Client may elect to pay Company to type and proofread any written content not submitted in the electronic formats specified above.
explanation: This section states that the Company will not proofread or correct errors in content submitted by the Client but then later states that the Client can pay the company to do this. This is an inconsistency in the text.

section: Client shall pay an additional surcharge for any services requiring work to be performed outside of normal business hours by reason of a rush deadline requested by Client or as a result of Client's failure to meet scheduled times for delivery and/or review and approval of information, content and materials. The surcharge for rush work shall be the hourly rate plus twenty-five percent (25%).
explanation: This section outlines that a surcharge will be applied when the Client requires work outside of normal business hours. However, the contract does not specify what the hourly rate is. This is an omission in the text and causes it to be confusing to interpret.

section: Client shall pay an additional surcharge for any services requiring work to be performed outside of normal business hours by reason of a rush deadline requested by Client or as a result of Client's failure to meet scheduled times for delivery and/or review and approval of information, content and materials. The surcharge for rush work shall be the hourly rate plus twenty-five percent (25%).
explanation: The phrase 'Client's failure to meet scheduled times for delivery and/or review and approval of information, content and materials' is vague. The contract doesn't specify how these 'scheduled times' are determined, communicated, or documented. This ambiguity could lead to disputes about whether the client actually failed to meet a defined schedule and is therefore subject to the surcharge.
